subject: Sales
title: Positioning: Owning a Word
description: One-minute skill: Positioning: Owning a Word.

hook.text: Say 'safety' and you think Volvo. Say 'overnight' and you think FedEx. That's positioning perfected.

buildup.text: Positioning means occupying one specific concept in the buyer's mind. It's your mental real estate.

discovery.text: Ries and Trout wrote the book on it. The brand that owns the position wins the entire category.

twist.text: You can't claim a word someone else already owns. Trying to out-Volvo Volvo on safety is futile.

climax.text: Find an unclaimed position. Own it with every message until the word belongs exclusively to you.

punchline.text: Own one word in the buyer's mind. That's positioning.

quiz.question: What does positioning mean in branding?
options: Owning a specific concept in the buyer's mind
